text: Feeling like a jerk for not making enough progress on this other than the collection view. The UINavigationController subclass will also be a good spot to throw up the "curtain" to play the faux launch videos (or whatever)

Question for Jordan design team: I was thinking about the feed interface this weekend and wondering: do we need to add some element/button that hops people back up to the top of the feed once they've scrolled down a ways?
tap status bar?
I thought we were hiding that
it's still an area
that could be tap-able

well let's give that a try for now. My concern - and we'll have to see if this plays out - is differentiating between a tap of content and a tap of the status bar. But let's see how it works in a demo and reassess
FYI - I just invited everybody to a trello board that I'm hoping can start tracking status of the various sections
will be filling it out with Mary
re "back to top," the other easy option would be to mimic the top right icon square in the bottom right corner with an icon (mabye the back turned up) floating over content
yeah - I was sort of imagining something like that as well
either way, i also like removing UI when we can. I'm curious how it works at the top, i think the top icons do a good job of "protecting the space"

Hey all. Bad news on scheduling this week. They're not in the office on the 3rd, so we have a few Wednesday openings. Let's discuss what we'll be able to show by Wednesday. <@U0289USNA> and  <@U026PHQ3J> would particularly like your thoughts...
Our other option would be trying to push until Monday, but we need to keep our eyes on final delivery and overall hours
is pushing to friday an option? Show more
oh
forgot 4th
Can't we do Monday and push a day or two? We're not the ones burning the deadline here
Yep, that's why I was asking. I think pushing to Monday is reasonable, and will see what they're availability is.
Since this is a checkin/first look at prototype, it doesn't necessarily push out the launch date, even. Depending on the extent of feedback.

My opinion is that wednesday is very premature to bother showing anything "functional"  if it's a continued design review, that is one thing, but distributing a functional app on wednesday just sounds like a recipe for a let-down.  there's lots of apparent good vibes and mojo going based on the designs and a pre-mature build would be a disappointment to them.
justin: are we sure that we don't want to display a filename for docs? <http://cl.ly/image/0x1R1z1y3X1r>
vs <http://cl.ly/image/0w211r2r1c3k>
especially thinking about when there is no comment
no - I'm not sure about almost any of this :grinning:
I think that's a good call
Guys. Time to lock it down.
A file was shared
yeah. absolutely
okay cool - I think this will work. I tighten up the wireframes a little more for phillip
looks and sounds good to me
cool. phillip, feel free to move buttons to fit the system / nav
but those are the actions
yeah - 100%
this is NOT design
helps so much though
just knowing that we dont have to think too hard about it
for sure
What's a thread?
a group message
<!channel>: Feed is Comp'd, Spec'd, and Cut. Various files on the NAS > Clients > Jordan > Dev
A file was shared
A file was shared
A file was shared
A file was shared
hey guys - here's an updated version of messaging based on our conversation this afternoon
something to note (mostly <@U02AUNA0P> but sort of everyone):
updated message titles: as we talked about I reduced the size of these and added a little button to show the expanded list of people on that thread
I updated the way we show multiple people on a thread. It's a little closer to iOS Messages now: basically we're just showing people in the recipient field

If there is more than one recipient, once the first message is sent to initiate the thread, the person starting the message is asked if they want to name the thread. If not we'll default "group message"
also - in the recipient field there is a "+" button - this links to the mini address book (mini only in that it's just about adding people to the thread, not linking out to their profile).
in the mini address book you can add multiple people the the message thread
Okay - I think that covers what we talked about today. Let me know if I've monkeyed any of this up or if any of you were visualizing something different
A file was shared
Again, all the stuff for Feed is on the NAS, including this generic color guide. Working on gettting messages and menu up tomorrow
